page.title: 07 THE SWINTON ESTATE
page.content: In 1695 Abstruptus Danby bought the manor of Swinton and built a manor house there.Over the years stables, fine gates, and a chain of lakes were added.In the 19th century the house was castellated. The present Lord Masham no longer lives there, Swinton Castle having been sold in the mid-seventies to help pay of death duties.It was bought by the Lindley Educational Trust which was established 30 years ago to train people in industry through outdoor experience. The Earl of Swinton, David Cunliffe- Lister,is Education Spokesman in the House Of Lords.His wife Baroness Masham is well known as a peeress and a champion for the disabled since a riding accident paralysed her 20 years ago. Swinton Estate employs 35 people in farming and gamekeeping.
